## BehaviouralTypeDescriptor interface

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface BehaviouralTypeDescriptor<T = any> extends EndpointTypeDescriptor 
```
<b>Extends:</b> [EndpointTypeDescriptor](./core.endpointtypedescriptor.md)

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [allowLoopback?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.allowloopback.md) | boolean | <i>(Optional)</i> Defaults to true. If false, the user will not be permitted to drag a connection from the current node to itself. |
|  [edgeType?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.edgetype.md) | string | <i>(Optional)</i> |
|  [extract?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.extract.md) | Dictionary&lt;string&gt; | <i>(Optional)</i> |
|  [onMaxConnections?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.onmaxconnections.md) | (value: any, event?: any) =&gt; any | <i>(Optional)</i> Optional function to call if the user begins a new connection drag when the associated element is full. |
|  [parameterExtractor?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.parameterextractor.md) | (el: T, eventTarget: T) =&gt; Dictionary&lt;string&gt; | <i>(Optional)</i> |
|  [parentSelector?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.parentselector.md) | string | <i>(Optional)</i> Optional selector identifying the ancestor of the event target that could be the element to which connections are added. By default this is the internal attribute jsPlumb uses to mark managed elements (data-jtk-managed) |
|  [portId?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.portid.md) | string | <i>(Optional)</i> |
|  [rank?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.rank.md) | number | <i>(Optional)</i> |
|  [redrop?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.redrop.md) | [RedropPolicy](./core.redroppolicy.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> |
|  [uniqueEndpoint?](./core.behaviouraltypedescriptor.uniqueendpoint.md) | boolean | <i>(Optional)</i> |
